question: For a take-off from a contaminated runway, which of the following statements is correct?

choices.choice: Dry snow is not considered to affect the take-off performance.
A slush covered runway must be cleared before take-off, even if the performance data for contaminated runway is available.
The performance data for take-off is determined in general by means of calculation, only a few values are verified by flight tests.
The greater the depth of contamination at constant take-off mass, the more V1 has to be decreased to compensate for decreasing friction.

subject: Performance
topic: Class A Aircraft Additional Take Off Procedure

question: Reduced take-off thrust is prohibited when:

choices.choice: obstacles are present close to the end of the runway.

subject: Performance
topic: Class A Aircraft Additional Take Off Procedure

question: Due to a lot of standing water on the runway the field length limited take-off mass will be:

choices.choice: only higher for three and four engine aeroplanes.

subject: Performance
topic: Class A Aircraft Additional Take Off Procedure

question: Which statement about reduced thrust is correct?

choices.choice: In case of reduced thrust V1 should be decreased.
Reduced thrust can be used when the actual take-off mass is less than the field length limited take-off mass.
Reduced thrust is primarily a noise abatement procedure.
Reduced thrust is used in order to save fuel.

subject: Performance
topic: Class A Aircraft Additional Take Off Procedure

question: If the antiskid system is inoperative, which of the following statements is true?

choices.choice: It has no effect on the accelerate stop distance.
Take-off with antiskid inoperative is not permitted.

subject: Performance
topic: Class A Aircraft Additional Take Off Procedure

question: When V1 has to be reduced because of a wet runway, the one engine out obstacle clearance / climb performance.
subject: Performance
topic: Class A Aircraft Additional Take Off Procedure

question: With regard to a take-off from a wet runway, which of the following statements is correct?

choices.choice: The screen height can be lowered to reduce the mass penalties.
When the runway is wet, the V1 reduction is sufficient to maintain the same margins on the runway length
In case of a thrust reverser inoperative, the wet runway performance information can still be used.

subject: Performance
topic: Class A Aircraft Additional Take Off Procedure

subject: Performance

question: The climb limited take-off mass can be increased by:

choices.choice: a lower flap setting for take-off and selecting a higher V2.

question: Which is the effect of a greater contamination depth on the reduction to the take-off mass and the reduction to V1 respectively?
subject: Performance

question: Reduced take-off thrust should normally not be used when:

choices.choice: windshear is reported on the take-off path.

topic: Class A Aircraft Additional Take Off Procedure

question: Reduced take-off thrust:

choices.choice: can be used if the headwind component during take-off is at least 10 kt.
has the benefit of improving engine life.
can be used if the actual take-off mass is higher than the performance limited take-off mass.
is not recommended at very low temperatures.

subject: Performance
